feed.title: SAP Community - SD (Sales and Distribution)
feed.subtitle: SD (Sales and Distribution) Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Sales Schedule Lines and ODO Dates
entry.content:
Hello 

Using SAP 4/HANA Public Cloud, 

We are a distributor and products can be received earlier than PO schedule lines (which is reflected in the SO schedule line and updated via BOP).  When the material is receipted in the ODO gets created but it has the SO schedule line on it. As our customers want to get their products as soon as possible how can we get the ODO to be created on the date receipted and not the sales order schedule line?

Note understand that in SAP S/4HANA, when creating an ODO, the system primarily relies on the schedule lines of the sales order, rather than the actual goods receipt date (delivery date of the inbound delivery), even if the product is received earlier than planned. 

How do others manage this process? 

Adam

entry.title: EDI Order import Failed due to 3 or more decimal point
entry.content:
We are facing an issue while import an order line with 3 or more decimal point.  We are using the Standard api to process the IDoc. Please see below error log.

-----faultDetail    
------severity    error
------text    Amount 0.738800 cannot be converted to SAP internal format
------id    008(EDI_SD)
-----faultDetail    
------severity    error
------text    Technical mapping failed
------id    026(EDI_SD)
-----faultDetail    
------severity    error
------text    Number of decimal places exceeds maximum allowed
------id    042(S&)

Any help greatly appreciated. Thanks

entry.content:

how to do that?

I try to set up job and job run successfully but no spool and also no mail forward

BS

jens

entry.title: No Configuration available for "Availability check Control" in SAP S4 HANA?
entry.content: In ECC, there were some fields available in "Availability check Control" to control the requirements. However in S4HANA, i do not see them(neither in aATP). How to control Total Sales/Delivery Requirements?

entry.title: DA, DX partner should be displayed below to partners SP ,SH, BP and PY in VA01
entry.content:
Hi 

Business is looking to display the DA, DX partners after SP,BP,PY and SH  or below to all the partners in VA01 under partners tab.

when we try to enter DA and DX partners manually in VA01 system is displaying below to SP but business is looking for below all partners.

e.g. after saving the sales order the DA and DX partners are reflecting below to SP.

Tried to check the VOPAN set up of the sequence number but it is not making any difference.

ZE , ZK ,ZR and ZT partners are assigned without sequence series also.

DA,DX are having similar set up like ZE,ZX,ZR and ZT in the above config but DA and DX are displaying immediate below to SP where as ZE,ZX ,ZR and ZT are displaying below to all mandatory functions like SP,BP,PY and SH.

Please let me know what set up is needed for DA and DX to be displayed below all partners.

thanks

entry.title: Image upload in Public cloud
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am trying to upload image attachments for product master data using the Migrate Your Data – Migration Cockpit with the Document Info Record (DIR) migration object. However, during the simulation step, I encountered the following error message:

"Active repository must be Document Management Service in Cloud Foundry environment."

Please help me understand the root cause of this issue and guide me on how to configure the system correctly so that image attachments can be uploaded successfully using the Migration Cockpit.

Best Regards,

Dinesh U

entry.title: Delivery from a different plant than production in Make-to-Order (KMAT Material)
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA , we produce configurable steel (KMAT) in Plant A and move it to Plant B for shipment.

The sales order is created for Plant A (production site), but physical delivery must occur from Plant B (port/distribution). How can I handle this? As delivery always takes the plant from the sales order? is there any work around?

entry.title: Status user not allowed to create purchase requisition
entry.content: Olá, pessoal. Preciso criar pedidos de venda no ambiente de QA para testar o frete. Mas sempre ocorre este erro: " Status do usuário não têm permissão para criar solicitações de compra". Não preciso de uma solicitação de compra porque não tenho estoque. É possível desabilitar essa solicitação? Uso uma transação Z para criar os pedidos.

entry.title: Wrong partners in bill type IG Internal Credit Memo
entry.content:
Dear gurus,

 

we are having some trouble concerning partner determination for cross-company stock transfer, especially with return shipments.

 

The situation is this: Company code A sells a material to company code B.

 

We create a stoc-transfer-order (STO), a delivery note and the bill. In the bill (type IV intercompany Billing), partners Sold-to-party, Bill-to-party and Payer is the customer number of company code B. Just as expected.

 

BUT when we try to return materials from company code B to Company code A, we create a STO with an item with “Returns Item” picked. In the delivery created (type NCR Ret.StTranspOrd CC), partner Ship-to Party is the customer number of company code A.

This seems ok, but when we continue to create the bill (type IG Internal Credit Memo), the partners Sold-to Party, Bill-to Party and Payer is the customer number of Company code A (!) as well.

This just seems wrong and differs greatly from the original bill. Of course, this causes further problems with creating output documents, because company code A is printed as the recipient of the credit memo, which is just nonsense.

 

Any ideas on how to change this? I do not think we changed the standard customizing here, which is even more weird.

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

 

Thank you
Jens

entry.title: Poland (PL) VAT rounding issue in Invoice Correction RK/G2
entry.content:
Hello Team,

We have a Poland (PL) VAT rounding issue in Invoice Correction RK/G2

You create an invoice correction request RK and a correction invoice G2.

Both contain matching item pairs (original vs. correction line).

The system calculates VAT per line against the tax condition, but for some scenarios,  a rounding difference occurs:

For Example:
Item line 20: VAT= 727.41 PLN
Correcting line:, Item line 240: VAT=727.40 PLN

G2 Invoice

The system posts a condition round difference (KDIFF).

Polish authorities expect the same VAT per item pair and not rounding mismatch.

I could not find anything in the SAP notes related to this situation. 

Can you guide me how to fix this rounding issue?

The tax condition is set as Commercial rounding.

Many thanks

entry.title: Customer Confirmation on Proof of Delivery
entry.content:
Hi All

The SAP provided proof of delivery processing allows you to record what the customer has indicated as the actual receipt of goods so that the customer can only be invoiced based on the PoD processed for the customer.

However, there seems to be no functionality / text available where a customer's confirmation number / verification number can be stored in the underlying delivery document when the POD is processed. That could lead to conflicts as there is no place to have a customer confirmation number be captured in the delivery when the POD is processed.

How do we capture the customer's POD reference and Date on the POD transaction ?

Appreciate your help

Regards

Rohit Zalani

entry.title: Customer stock in custody
entry.content:
Hi all,
I have materials that were purchased for a customer. We need to do the outbound delivery, Goods Issue and then invoice them, but the customer won't receive the materials until they instruct us to deliver them. Therefore, we need to keep these materials in our warehouse, under our responsibility.

Since the materials will no longer be ours, can the same material numbers be used to manage them with the respective quantities as customer property in our custody? What should the process be? Or should the same ones be created as UNBW material type? if yes, I'm also unclear on the correct process for entering the materials, identifying them as belonging to the customer, and then making the delivery when the customer requests it.

Can anyone help me with this scenario?
Thanks in advance!

entry.title: New pricing getting updated in rejected line item
entry.content: New price is getting updated in Rejected line item. How to make the rejected line completely obsolete ?

entry.title: Scale Pricing in Sales Based on Characteristic Value
entry.content:
Good evening,

Is it possible to do scale pricing (VK11) based on the value of a characteristic in the variant configurator in the sales order?

For example, the customer pays a fixed rate per size interval.

100-999 mm = €100

1000-1999mm = €175

2000-2500mm = €170.

In the variant configurator, we have the characteristic PRODUCT_SIZE, this is a field in which any value between 100 and 2500mm can be filled, to determine the product size. From a pricing point of view, the product size falls within one of the intervals above.

How can we make sure the correct sales price is selected based on the interval in which the value for PRODUCT_SIZE falls?

Is it possible to combine this with tier pricing/scales?

Thanks in advance,

Floyd

entry.title: Scrapping Materials from Warehouse
entry.content:
Hi Experts,
I am seeking your advice on how to address a current business requirement related to our scrapping process.
At present, the warehouse receives a long list of valuated materials from Finance that need to be scrapped. The warehouse posts the scrapping using MIGO with movement type 551. After the MIGO posting is completed, the system generates a Transfer Requirement (TR) and subsequently a Transfer Order (TO), which allows pickers to use the RF gun for picking.
However, the warehouse’s concern is that this process does not include a release strategy, unlike what is available in the Purchase Order process. Because of this, the business is considering two alternative approaches:

Option 1: Sales Order (VA01) with a New Order Type for Scrapping

  1. Would require setting up a generic Sold-to Party and Ship-to Party specifically for scrapping.
  2. Proper G/L account and cost center assignment would be required to ensure correct financial posting.
  3. Limitation: This method does not support a release strategy, which is a key control requirement.

Option 2: Internal Purchase Order for Scrapping

  1. A Purchase Order can incorporate a Release Strategy, which addresses the control concern.
  2. However, questions arise regarding the supplier setup:
  3. Would this require creating an internal vendor?
  4. Would this effectively become a type of STO process, and how would the end-to-end flow work?
  5. Additional consideration is ensuring correct posting to the appropriate G/L accounts and cost centers.

I would appreciate your guidance or recommended approach to meet the following objectives:

  1. Ensure scrapping has an appropriate approval / release mechanism.
  2. Maintain an efficient warehouse execution process, including TR/TO creation and RF picking.
  3. Avoid unnecessary complexity or unintended financial impacts.

Any insights, best practices, or step-by-step guidance would be greatly appreciated.
Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: VOFM routines are not being triggered
entry.content: I created and activated a VOFM routine and then ran report RV80HGEN. However, when I execute VL10B, the routine is still not being triggered. What could be the possible reasons for this?
